source.5d2ff092: LabelEncoder is implemented in the "Encoded" column to assign individual number for each country. The numbers are created randomly. For example, Aruba is represented by 10, Angola is represented by 5 etc. after implementing LabelEncoder. If we directly used "Country Name" and "Year" as independent variables in order to predict the GDP, then our model would not be able to predict the GDP as the values in "Country Name" column are string. So, we must represent the country names by numbers.

source.1874e063: Then I have imported linear regression model and assigned the independent (x) and dependent (y) variables. Independent variables are "Encoded" (Country Name) and "Year". Dependent variable (which will be predicted) is GDP.

source.295d2514:
# Introduction:
In this program, I have predicted the GDPs of 2018 for all countries from modifiedGDP.csv file by training existing GDPs. Finally, I have stored all the datas of modifiedGDP.csv and predicted new GDPs for 2018 in new_GDP.csv file. I have implemented linear regression model for the predictions.
